column3: Comparing the two methods, which one did you prefer for the task of designing an assignment question?
column5: If the ADATA system were available to you, how likely would you be to use it in your regular TA duties?
column6: Do you think regular use of this platform would: [Improve my question design skills over time]
column7: Do you think regular use of this platform would: [Help me learn pedagogical best practices]
column8: Do you think regular use of this platform would: [Make me too dependent on AI]
column9: Any other comments, suggestions, or feedback?

column3: Strongly prefer WITH the ADATA platform
column4: the design of the prompts help much but it need to design for each course at least one time

I am not sure which one to decide, because whila ADATA platform makes it really easy and straightforward, i feel i have more options and flexibility without it and for now i have more trust in prompting known LLMs like gemini or gpt

column3: Somewhat prefer WITH the ADATA platform
column4: I prefer ADATA since I think it was good in innovation and diversity of the created problems.

column4: This platform helps a lot with idea generation and brainstorming. It can be used to increase the quality of questions and make them more innovative. Because of that and the fact that it reduced my spend time for question design, I would prefer to use this platform in future.
